author: nightroman
body:
(UPDATE: I keep the original post but the problem is easier to reproduce, see further comments)

v7.0.0-rc.1 regression - error on error formatting with strict mode and default host

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# v6-rc: fixed
# v7.0.0-rc.1: fails "The property 'ErrorCategory_Message' cannot be found on this object."

[PowerShell]::Create().AddScript({
    $ErrorView = 'NormalView' #! v7
    Set-StrictMode -Version 2
    try {
        throw 'Oops!'
    }
    catch {
        'Error {'
        $_ | Out-String
        '}'
        $Error[0]
    }
}).Invoke()
```

# Expected behavior

The code above works and prints something like

```
Error {
    Oops! ...
}
Oops! ...
```

# Actual behavior

Formatting of the error (`$_ | Out-String`) fails

```
Error {


}

PropertyNotFoundException:
Line |
 231 |                                         $errorCategoryMsg = $err.ErrorCategory_Message

     |                                         ^ The property 'ErrorCategory_Message' cannot be found on this object. Verify that the property exists.
```

In the above, `$err.ErrorCategory_Message` looks strange. Should it be `$err.ErrorCategory.Message` perhaps (`.` instead of `_`)?

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.body: This article describes the history of the issue - [Strict-mode-ErrorRecord-formatting](https://github.com/nightroman/PowerShellTraps/tree/master/Basic/Strict-mode-ErrorRecord-formatting). It used to be a problem in v2 - v5, then fixed in v6-rc - v7.0.0-preview.6, then it fails again in v7.0.0-rc.1.

comments.author: nightroman
comments.body:
More details, the default host is irrelevant. The problem is simpler to reproduce and therefore more serious, easier to meet in practice (e.g. I noticed that in one of my test projects all expected error messages "disappeared" from the output).

This code in v7.0.0-rc.1

```powershell
$ErrorView = 'NormalView'
Set-StrictMode -Version 2
try {
    throw 'Oops!'
}
catch {
    'Error {'
    $_ | Out-String
    '}'
    $Error[0]
}
```

produces unexpected output:

```
Error {


}
```

If we comment out `$ErrorView = 'NormalView'` then it produces expected output:

```
Error {

Exception: C:\tmp\1.ps1
Line |
   4 |     throw 'Oops!'

     |     ^ Oops!


}

Exception: C:\tmp\1.ps1
Line |
   4 |     throw 'Oops!'

     |     ^ Oops!
```

If we comment out `Set-StrictMode -Version 2` then it produces expected output:

```
Error {
Oops!
At C:\tmp\1.ps1:4 char:5
+     throw 'Oops!'
+     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : OperationStopped: (Oops!:String) [], RuntimeException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : Oops!


}
Oops!
At C:\tmp\1.ps1:4 char:5
+     throw 'Oops!'
+     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : OperationStopped: (Oops!:String) [], RuntimeException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : Oops!
```
